bit_field_value.name: VERID_FEATURE_0b0000000000000011
bit_field_value.description: Standard feature set with MODEM/IrDA support.

bit_field_value.name: PINCFG_TRGSEL_0b01
bit_field_value.description: Input trigger is used instead of RXD pin input.

bit_field_value.name: PINCFG_TRGSEL_0b10
bit_field_value.description: Input trigger is used instead of CTS_B pin input.

bit_field_value.name: PINCFG_TRGSEL_0b11
bit_field_value.description: Input trigger is used to modulate the TXD pin output. The TXD pin output (after TXINV configuration) is ANDed with the input trigger.

bit_field.name: RXEDGIE
bit_field.description: RX Input Active Edge Interrupt Enable

bit_field_value.name: BAUD_RXEDGIE_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Hardware interrupt requested when LPUART_STAT[RXEDGIF] flag is 1.

bit_field_value.name: BAUD_LBKDIE_0b0
bit_field_value.description: Hardware interrupts from LPUART_STAT[LBKDIF] disabled (use polling).

bit_field_value.name: BAUD_LBKDIE_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Hardware interrupt requested when LPUART_STAT[LBKDIF] flag is 1.

bit_field_value.name: BAUD_RESYNCDIS_0b0
bit_field_value.description: Resynchronization during received data word is supported

bit_field_value.name: BAUD_RESYNCDIS_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Resynchronization during received data word is disabled

bit_field_value.name: BAUD_BOTHEDGE_0b0
bit_field_value.description: Receiver samples input data using the rising edge of the baud rate clock.

bit_field_value.name: BAUD_BOTHEDGE_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Receiver samples input data using the rising and falling edge of the baud rate clock.

bit_field_value.name: BAUD_MATCFG_0b11
bit_field_value.description: Enables RWU on Data Match and Match On/Off for transmitter CTS input

bit_field_value.name: BAUD_OSR_0b00000
bit_field_value.description: Writing 0 to this field will result in an oversampling ratio of 16

bit_field_value.name: BAUD_OSR_0b00011
bit_field_value.description: Oversampling ratio of 4, requires BOTHEDGE to be set.

bit_field_value.name: BAUD_OSR_0b00100
bit_field_value.description: Oversampling ratio of 5, requires BOTHEDGE to be set.

bit_field_value.name: BAUD_OSR_0b00101
bit_field_value.description: Oversampling ratio of 6, requires BOTHEDGE to be set.

bit_field_value.name: BAUD_OSR_0b00110
bit_field_value.description: Oversampling ratio of 7, requires BOTHEDGE to be set.

bit_field_value.name: BAUD_M10_0b0
bit_field_value.description: Receiver and transmitter use 7-bit to 9-bit data characters.

bit_field_value.name: BAUD_M10_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Receiver and transmitter use 10-bit data characters.

bit_field_value.name: BAUD_MAEN2_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Enables automatic address matching or data matching mode for MATCH[MA2].

bit_field_value.name: BAUD_MAEN1_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Enables automatic address matching or data matching mode for MATCH[MA1].

bit_field_value.name: STAT_MA2F_0b0
bit_field_value.description: Received data is not equal to MA2

bit_field_value.name: STAT_MA2F_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Received data is equal to MA2

bit_field_value.name: STAT_MA1F_0b0
bit_field_value.description: Received data is not equal to MA1

bit_field_value.name: STAT_MA1F_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Received data is equal to MA1

bit_field_value.name: STAT_FE_0b0
bit_field_value.description: No framing error detected. This does not guarantee the framing is correct.

bit_field_value.name: STAT_NF_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Noise detected in the received character in LPUART_DATA.

bit_field_value.name: STAT_TC_0b0
bit_field_value.description: Transmitter active (sending data, a preamble, or a break).

bit_field_value.name: STAT_RAF_0b0
bit_field_value.description: LPUART receiver idle waiting for a start bit.

bit_field_value.name: STAT_RAF_0b1
bit_field_value.description: LPUART receiver active (RXD input not idle).

bit_field_value.name: STAT_LBKDE_0b0
bit_field_value.description: LIN break detect is disabled, normal break character can be detected.

bit_field_value.name: STAT_LBKDE_0b1
bit_field_value.description: LIN break detect is enabled. LIN break character is detected at length of 11 bit times (if M = 0) or 12 (if M = 1) or 13 (M10 = 1).

bit_field_value.name: STAT_BRK13_0b0
bit_field_value.description: Break character is transmitted with length of 9 to 13 bit times.

bit_field_value.name: STAT_BRK13_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Break character is transmitted with length of 12 to 15 bit times.

bit_field_value.name: STAT_RWUID_0b0
bit_field_value.description: During receive standby state (RWU = 1), the IDLE bit does not get set upon detection of an idle character. During address match wakeup, the IDLE bit does not set when an address does not match.

bit_field_value.name: STAT_RWUID_0b1
bit_field_value.description: During receive standby state (RWU = 1), the IDLE bit gets set upon detection of an idle character. During address match wakeup, the IDLE bit does set when an address does not match.

bit_field_value.name: STAT_MSBF_0b0
bit_field_value.description: LSB (bit0) is the first bit that is transmitted following the start bit. Further, the first bit received after the start bit is identified as bit0.

bit_field_value.name: STAT_MSBF_0b1
bit_field_value.description: MSB (bit9, bit8, bit7 or bit6) is the first bit that is transmitted following the start bit depending on the setting of CTRL[M], CTRL[PE] and BAUD[M10]. Further, the first bit received after the start bit is identified as bit9, bit8, bit7 or bit6 depending on the setting of CTRL[M] and CTRL[PE].

bit_field.name: RXEDGIF
bit_field.description: RXD Pin Active Edge Interrupt Flag

bit_field_value.name: STAT_RXEDGIF_0b0
bit_field_value.description: No active edge on the receive pin has occurred.

bit_field_value.name: STAT_RXEDGIF_0b1
bit_field_value.description: An active edge on the receive pin has occurred.

bit_field_value.name: STAT_LBKDIF_0b0
bit_field_value.description: No LIN break character has been detected.

bit_field_value.name: STAT_LBKDIF_0b1
bit_field_value.description: LIN break character has been detected.

bit_field_value.name: CTRL_PE_0b0
bit_field_value.description: No hardware parity generation or checking.

bit_field_value.name: CTRL_ILT_0b0
bit_field_value.description: Idle character bit count starts after start bit.

bit_field_value.name: CTRL_ILT_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Idle character bit count starts after stop bit.

bit_field_value.name: CTRL_M_0b0
bit_field_value.description: Receiver and transmitter use 8-bit data characters.

bit_field_value.name: CTRL_M_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Receiver and transmitter use 9-bit data characters.

bit_field_value.name: CTRL_RSRC_0b0
bit_field_value.description: Provided LOOPS is set, RSRC is cleared, selects internal loop back mode and the LPUART does not use the RXD pin.

bit_field_value.name: CTRL_RSRC_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Single-wire LPUART mode where the TXD pin is connected to the transmitter output and receiver input.

bit_field_value.name: CTRL_DOZEEN_0b0
bit_field_value.description: LPUART is enabled in Doze mode.

bit_field_value.name: CTRL_DOZEEN_0b1
bit_field_value.description: LPUART is disabled in Doze mode.

bit_field_value.name: CTRL_LOOPS_0b0
bit_field_value.description: Normal operation - RXD and TXD use separate pins.

bit_field_value.name: CTRL_LOOPS_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Loop mode or single-wire mode where transmitter outputs are internally connected to receiver input (see RSRC bit).

bit_field_value.name: CTRL_M7_0b0
bit_field_value.description: Receiver and transmitter use 8-bit to 10-bit data characters.

bit_field_value.name: CTRL_M7_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Receiver and transmitter use 7-bit data characters.

bit_field_value.name: CTRL_SBK_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Queue break character(s) to be sent.

bit_field_value.name: CTRL_RWU_0b1
bit_field_value.description: LPUART receiver in standby waiting for wakeup condition.

bit_field_value.name: CTRL_ILIE_0b0
bit_field_value.description: Hardware interrupts from IDLE disabled; use polling.

bit_field_value.name: CTRL_ILIE_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Hardware interrupt requested when IDLE flag is 1.

bit_field_value.name: CTRL_RIE_0b0
bit_field_value.description: Hardware interrupts from RDRF disabled; use polling.

bit_field_value.name: CTRL_RIE_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Hardware interrupt requested when RDRF flag is 1.

bit_field_value.name: CTRL_TCIE_0b0
bit_field_value.description: Hardware interrupts from TC disabled; use polling.

bit_field_value.name: CTRL_TCIE_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Hardware interrupt requested when TC flag is 1.

bit_field_value.name: CTRL_TIE_0b0
bit_field_value.description: Hardware interrupts from TDRE disabled; use polling.

bit_field_value.name: CTRL_TIE_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Hardware interrupt requested when TDRE flag is 1.

bit_field_value.name: CTRL_PEIE_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Hardware interrupt requested when PF is set.

bit_field_value.name: CTRL_FEIE_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Hardware interrupt requested when FE is set.

bit_field_value.name: CTRL_NEIE_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Hardware interrupt requested when NF is set.

bit_field_value.name: CTRL_ORIE_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Hardware interrupt requested when OR is set.

bit_field.name: TXDIR
bit_field.description: TXD Pin Direction in Single-Wire Mode

bit_field_value.name: CTRL_TXDIR_0b0
bit_field_value.description: TXD pin is an input in single-wire mode.

bit_field_value.name: CTRL_TXDIR_0b1
bit_field_value.description: TXD pin is an output in single-wire mode.

bit_field_value.name: DATA_IDLINE_0b0
bit_field_value.description: Receiver was not idle before receiving this character.

bit_field_value.name: DATA_IDLINE_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Receiver was idle before receiving this character.

bit_field_value.name: DATA_RXEMPT_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Receive buffer is empty, data returned on read is not valid.

bit_field_value.name: DATA_FRETSC_0b0
bit_field_value.description: The dataword was received without a frame error on read, or transmit a normal character on write.

bit_field_value.name: DATA_FRETSC_0b1
bit_field_value.description: The dataword was received with a frame error, or transmit an idle or break character on transmit.

bit_field_value.name: DATA_PARITYE_0b0
bit_field_value.description: The dataword was received without a parity error.

bit_field_value.name: DATA_PARITYE_0b1
bit_field_value.description: The dataword was received with a parity error.

bit_field_value.name: DATA_NOISY_0b0
bit_field_value.description: The dataword was received without noise.

bit_field_value.name: DATA_NOISY_0b1
bit_field_value.description: The data was received with noise.

bit_field_value.name: MODIR_TXCTSE_0b0
bit_field_value.description: CTS has no effect on the transmitter.

bit_field_value.name: MODIR_TXCTSE_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Enables clear-to-send operation. The transmitter checks the state of CTS each time it is ready to send a character. If CTS is asserted, the character is sent. If CTS is deasserted, the signal TXD remains in the mark state and transmission is delayed until CTS is asserted. Changes in CTS as a character is being sent do not affect its transmission.

bit_field_value.name: MODIR_TXRTSE_0b0
bit_field_value.description: The transmitter has no effect on RTS.

bit_field_value.name: MODIR_TXRTSE_0b1
bit_field_value.description: When a character is placed into an empty transmitter data buffer , RTS asserts one bit time before the start bit is transmitted. RTS deasserts one bit time after all characters in the transmitter data buffer and shift register are completely sent, including the last stop bit.

bit_field_value.name: MODIR_RXRTSE_0b0
bit_field_value.description: The receiver has no effect on RTS.

bit_field_value.name: MODIR_RXRTSE_0b1
bit_field_value.description: RTS is deasserted if the receiver data register is full or a start bit has been detected that would cause the receiver data register to become full. RTS is asserted if the receiver data register is not full and has not detected a start bit that would cause the receiver data register to become full.

bit_field_value.name: MODIR_TXCTSC_0b0
bit_field_value.description: CTS input is sampled at the start of each character.

bit_field_value.name: MODIR_TXCTSC_0b1
bit_field_value.description: CTS input is sampled when the transmitter is idle.

bit_field_value.name: MODIR_TXCTSSRC_0b0
bit_field_value.description: CTS input is the CTS_B pin.

bit_field_value.name: MODIR_TXCTSSRC_0b1
bit_field_value.description: CTS input is the inverted Receiver Match result.

bit_field_value.name: FIFO_RXFE_0b0
bit_field_value.description: Receive FIFO is not enabled. Buffer is depth 1. (Legacy support)

bit_field_value.name: FIFO_RXFE_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Receive FIFO is enabled. Buffer is depth indicted by RXFIFOSIZE.

bit_field_value.name: FIFO_TXFE_0b0
bit_field_value.description: Transmit FIFO is not enabled. Buffer is depth 1. (Legacy support).

bit_field_value.name: FIFO_TXFE_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Transmit FIFO is enabled. Buffer is depth indicated by TXFIFOSIZE.

bit_field_value.name: FIFO_RXUFE_0b0
bit_field_value.description: RXUF flag does not generate an interrupt to the host.

bit_field_value.name: FIFO_RXUFE_0b1
bit_field_value.description: RXUF flag generates an interrupt to the host.

bit_field_value.name: FIFO_TXOFE_0b0
bit_field_value.description: TXOF flag does not generate an interrupt to the host.

bit_field_value.name: FIFO_TXOFE_0b1
bit_field_value.description: TXOF flag generates an interrupt to the host.

bit_field_value.name: FIFO_RXIDEN_0b000
bit_field_value.description: Disable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle.

bit_field_value.name: FIFO_RXIDEN_0b001
bit_field_value.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 1 character.

bit_field_value.name: FIFO_RXIDEN_0b010
bit_field_value.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 2 characters.

bit_field_value.name: FIFO_RXIDEN_0b011
bit_field_value.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 4 characters.

bit_field_value.name: FIFO_RXIDEN_0b100
bit_field_value.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 8 characters.

bit_field_value.name: FIFO_RXIDEN_0b101
bit_field_value.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 16 characters.

bit_field_value.name: FIFO_RXIDEN_0b110
bit_field_value.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 32 characters.

bit_field_value.name: FIFO_RXIDEN_0b111
bit_field_value.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 64 characters.

bit_field_value.name: FIFO_RXFLUSH_0b1
bit_field_value.description: All data in the receive FIFO/buffer is cleared out.

bit_field_value.name: FIFO_TXFLUSH_0b1
bit_field_value.description: All data in the transmit FIFO/Buffer is cleared out.

bit_field_value.name: FIFO_RXUF_0b0
bit_field_value.description: No receive buffer underflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.

bit_field_value.name: FIFO_RXUF_0b1
bit_field_value.description: At least one receive buffer underflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.

bit_field_value.name: FIFO_TXOF_0b0
bit_field_value.description: No transmit buffer overflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.

bit_field_value.name: FIFO_TXOF_0b1
bit_field_value.description: At least one transmit buffer overflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.
